document.ModsDocTitle: Morphology of the first-instar nymph and adult female of Kermes echinatus Balachowsky, with a comparison to K. vermilio Planchon (Hemiptera, Coccoidea, Kermesidae)
document.masterDocTitle: Morphology of the first-instar nymph and adult female of Kermes echinatus Balachowsky, with a comparison to K. vermilio Planchon (Hemiptera, Coccoidea, Kermesidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Morphology of the first-instar nymph and adult female of Kermes echinatus Balachowsky, with a comparison to K. vermilio Planchon (Hemiptera, Coccoidea, Kermesidae)

subSubSection.paragraph: Kermes echinatus Balachowsky, 1953:181
Note.
This species was originally described from the first-instar nymph collected from Israel, Nahalal forest, off Quercus coccifera .
Material examined.

Adult female of Kermes echinatus . Israel: All material was collected off Quercus calliprinos by M. Spodek. At least twenty specimens were examined and all material is deposited in ICVI. Alonei Abba Reserve, 19.vi.2011, 26.vi.2011, 3.vi.2012 (MC:530, C:4999), MC:711); Eilon, 19.vi.2011, 22.vi.2011, 26.vi.2011, 3.vi.2012 (MC:533, MC:542, C:4998), MC:692); Nahal Dolev Reserve, 27.vi.2010, 17.vi.2011, 8.vi.2012, 15.vi.2012, 22.vi.2012 (MC:261, MC:699, MC:528, MC:695, MC:709); Hanita, 6.vi.2010 (MC:227); Mas'ada , 4.vii.2010 (MC:285); Nebi Hazuri, 4.vii.2010, 6.vii.2011 (MC:288, MC:556).
First-instar nymph of Kermes echinatus .

Israel: Syntype (ICVI C:3691, MNHN 1065-8), Nahalal Forest, Quercus coccifera 10.v.1950, Bytinski-Salz; All non-type material was collected off Quercus calliprinos by M. Spodek, unless otherwise stated; at least twenty specimens were examined and all material is deposited in ICVI. Alonei Abba Reserve, 15.vii.2010, 26.vi.2011, 15.vii.2012 (MC:289, MC:559, MC:719); Eilon, 26.ix.2010, 21.iv.2011, 17.vi.2011, 1.vii.2011, 22.vii.2012 (MC:306, MC:486, MC:499, MC:550, MC:718); Hanita, 13.iii.2011 (MC:457); Nahal Dolev, 22.viii.2010, 8.viii.2011, 1.vii.2012 (MC:293, MC:562, MC:717); Nebi Hazuri, 17.viii.2000, Y. Ben-Dov (C:3409), 4.vii.2010, 6.vii.2011, 17.vii.2011, (C:4818, C:5003, MC:561); Neve Zuf, 10.vii.2000, 18.vii.2003, Y. Ben-Dov (C:4752, C:4751); Timrat, 21.vii.2011, 25.iii.2012 (MC:563, MC:651).
Comparative material examined.

Adult female of Kermes vermilio .France: Corsica, Quercus ilex , 7.vi.1999, J. Casevitz-Weal (2 specimens, ICVI C:3277); Le Vert Lasalle, Quercus coccifera , 7.v.2007, D. Cardon (3 specimens, ICVI C:4257); Italy: Portofino, Quercus ilex , 27.v.1971, D. Matile-Ferrero (2 specimens, MNHN 4594-2), Pistoia, Quercus ilex , 13.viii.1986, A. Belcari (2 specimens, MNHN 10732-1), Bitonto (Bari), Quercus ilex , 25.vii.2012, F. Porcelli (10 specimens, ICVI C-5132); Spain: Mieras (Gerona), Quercus coccifera , 7.v.1987, A. Verhecken (1 specimen, MNHN 11526-1).
First-instar nymph of Kermes vermilio .

France: Le Vert Lasalle, Quercus coccifera , 24.vi.2007, D. Cardon (47 specimens, ICVI C:4272); Italy: Pistoia, Quercus ilex , 13.viii.1986, A. Belcari (6 specimens, MNHN 10732-3), Bitonto (Bari), Quercus ilex , 28.viii.2012, F. Porcelli (20 specimens, ICVI C-5133); Spain: Mieras (Gerona), Quercus coccifera , 7.v.1987, A. Verhecken (1 specimen, MNHN 11526-2).
Description adult female.

General appearance. Young, pre-reproductive adult: Oval, soft and slightly convex; dorsum brownish-grey with 4 or 5 black longitudinal and 6-9 black transverse lines formed of dots and lines; 2.5-3.2 mm long and 2-3 mm wide (Fig. 1). Fully-mature reproductive female highly convex; dorsum brownish-grey with black, longitudinal and transverse lines; body tapering posteriorly (Figs 2, 3). Post-reproductive female oval and moderately convex, 2.9-4.4 mm long, 2.7-5.1 mm wide and 3.2-4.8 mm high; dorsum sclerotized; red with 6-9 black, transverse black lines represented as reticulated folds (Fig. 4).

caption.paragraph: Figure 1. Kermes echinatus Balachowsky young adult female, general appearance.
Figure 2. Kermes echinatus Balachowsky mature reproductive female, general appearance.
Figure 3. Kermes echinatus Balachowsky gravid females on tree trunk, general appearance.
Figure 4. Kermes echinatus Balachowsky female with emerging first-instar nymphs.

subSubSection.paragraph: Slide-mountedadult female. 2-3 mm long and 2-2.8 mm wide (Fig. 5).

caption.paragraph: Figure 5. Kermes echinatus Balachowsky adult female.

subSubSection.paragraph: Margin. Marginal setae conical, 12-13 Âµm long and 10-11 Âµm wide at base; arranged in a single row of 30-38 setae on each margin.

Dorsum. Dorsal setae hair-like, 7-9 Âµm long, in submarginal band from cephalic tip of body to posterior end of body, about 28-33 on each side. Conical setae, similar in shape to marginal setae, randomly placed on dorsum, with 7-11 setae on each side; each seta 10-13 Âµm long and 7-10 wide at base. Bilocular pores oval with a sclerotized rim, each 3 Âµm long and 2 Âµm wide; present throughout. Tubular ducts diffused throughout dorsum; each with outer ductule 12-17 Âµm long, inner ductule 10-15 Âµm long and with a sclerotized cup 5 Âµm diameter.

Venter . Eyes circular, 20-25 Âµm diameter, each placed anterolaterally to each antenna. Legs absent. Antenna each 1-segmented; 26-35 Âµm long, 20-31 Âµm wide; eachbearing 5-8 fleshy setae; each antennae is surrounded by a group of 40-45 multilocular pores; each pore 7-8 Âµm diameter with 10 loculi. Clypeolabral shield 235-250 Âµm long, 212-225 Âµm wide. Labium 3-segmented, triangular, 160-175Âµm long, 110-135 Âµm wide; labial setae as follow: basal segment with 2 setae, 5-8 Âµm long; medial segment with 2 setae, 12-20 Âµm long; apical segment with 4 setae; 6 apical setae, 10-12 Âµm long and 2 subapical seta, 7-8 Âµm long. Mesothoracic and metathoracic spiracles subequal in size; peritreme 50-68 Âµm long and 30-37 Âµm wide; pores with 10 loculi and 8 Âµm wide in a group of 15-22 locular pores laterad to each spiracle; also with 2 pores with 6 loculi, each 6Âµm diameter, laterad to each anterior peritreme. Tubular ducts present in a complete, dense submarginal band about 11 ducts wide and also sparsely throughout rest of venter; each duct with outer ductule 10-16 Âµm long; inner end of outer ductule with a sclerotized cup, 4-5 Âµm diameter, and inner ductule 11-15 Âµm long. Multilocular pores each diameter 10 Âµm with 10-12 loculi, arranged in 2-3 transverse rows on each abdominal segment; with a total of 114-120 pores on each segment; also with a group of 52-56 pores just posterior to vulva. Bilocular pores each3 Âµm long and 2 Âµm wide, interspersed between tubular ducts in subma rginal band. Simple pores 2 Âµm diameter with a sclerotized rim, interspersed between multilocular pores on abdomen. Ventral setae 7-12 Âµm long, distributed as follows: about 12 setae just anterior to clypeus between antennae; about 8 setae on median and submedian areas of thorax; about 11 setae mesad to each submarginal band of tubular ducts, in a line from antennae to anal ring; 6 or 8setae, present in a band along each abdominal segment; plus 2 setae 20-25 Âµm long, placed medially on each abdominal segment. Microspines each 1-2 Âµm long, in groups of 3-5, in 3-8 rows on each abdominal segment. Anal ring ventral, forming a complete sclerotized circle; diameter 42-60 Âµm ; cells absent; with 6 setae, each 25-40 Âµm long. Other ventral setae 1 pair of setae, each 10-12 Âµm long, present just anterior to anal ring; 2 pairs of setae, each 10-12 Âµm long, present posteriorly to anal ring; 1 pair of stout conical setae (similar in shape to marginal spinose setae but shorter), each 10-12 Âµm long and wide, present on venter slightly above posterior margin; and 1 pair of apical setae, each 33-35 Âµm long.
First-instar nymph.

General appearance. Dorsum and venter red, body oval and tapering posteriorly, 0.37-0.44 mm long and 0.14-0.2 mm wide. Each with a fringe of curly white wax on margins once first-instars settle on branch for feeding (Fig. 6).

caption.paragraph: Figure 6. Kermes echinatus Balachowsky first-instar nymph, general appearance.

subSubSection.paragraph: Mountedspecimen. Oval, 0.45-0.49 mm long and 0.20-0.25 mm wide (Fig. 7).

caption.paragraph: Figure 7. Kermes echinatus Balachowsky first-instar nymph.

subSubSection.paragraph: Margin. Marginal setae conical and slightly curved apically, each 10-13 Âµm long and 5 Âµm wide at base, in a complete line of 17-22 on each side, smaller conical setae, not-curved, each 5-8 Âµm long and 3-5 Âµm wide at base, in a submarginal row of 12-14 setae extending from mesothorax to anal lobe.

Dorsum. Derm membranous; intersegmental lines observable. Dorsal setae 8, each 6-8 Âµm long, placed in 2 submedian, longitudinal rows on thorax. Simple pores circular, 14, eachabout1 Âµm diameter, placed in 2 submarginal, longitudinal rows on abdomen.

Venter. Antennae each 6-segmented; total length 102-110 Âµm ; with segment III and VI longest; setal distribution as follows: scape and pedicel each with 2 thin, hair-like setae; segment III with 1 long thin, hair-like seta; IV with 1 fleshy setae; V with 1 fleshy seta and 2 hair-like setae; apical segment with 2 fleshy setae and 5 hair-like setae. Legs well-developed; measurements of hind legs (length in Âµm ); coxae 25-30, trochanter + femur 68-70, tibia 33-38, tarsus 45-50, claw 15-20; total leg length 187-200 Âµm ; trochanter with 2 oval, sensory pores on each side, each pore 3 Âµm long and about 2 Âµm wide; setae present on all leg segments; tarsal digitules each 25-30 Âµm long and knobbed apically, extending beyond apex of claw;claw digitules knobbed apically, each 15-20 Âµm long; each claw with a single denticle near tip. Clypeolabral shield well-developed; 68-75 Âµm long and 63-75 Âµm wide. Labium 3-segmented, triangular, 75-83 Âµm long and 45-47 Âµm wide; labial setae as follows: basal segment with 1 setae, rarely 2 setae, 5-8 Âµm long, median segment with 2 hair-like setae on dorsal surface, 12-13 Âµm long, apical segment with 6 subapical setae, each 16-20 Âµm long and 2 apical setae 10-12 Âµm long. Spiracles subequal in size; each peritreme 3-5 Âµm diameter; apodeme crescent shaped, 13-15 Âµm long; each spiracle with 1 quinquelocular pore, 5 Âµm diameter, placed anterolaterally. Trilocular pores, each about 3 Âµm wide, distributed as follows: 2 pores between scape just anterior to clypeus; 1 mesad to each coxa, and 2 submedially on abdominal segments V-VII . Bilocular pores oval, 4 total, each 3 Âµm long and 2 Âµm wide, present between margin and each spiracle. Ventralsetae interantennal setae 6, each 38-45 Âµm long, in an longitudinal line medially between scapes; also 2 conical setae, about 14-16 Âµm long and 5 Âµm wide at base, on anterior apex of head; 1 seta 10-11 Âµm long, mesad to each coxa associated with each trilocular pore; and 6 longitudinal lines of setae on abdomen; with 2 medial, 2 submedial and 2 submarginal seta per segment; medial and submedial setae each 10-15 Âµm long, and submarginal setae 5-6 Âµm long. Microspines each about 3 Âµm long, arranged in groups of 3 or 4 in 2 transverse rows on each abdominal segment and sparsely on thorax. Anal ring located ventrally; composed of 2 semi-circles; diameter 20-25 Âµm ; each half circle with 4-6 cells and 3 pointed setae, each 13-18 Âµm long. Other setae with a pair of setae , each 15-18 Âµm long, anterior to anal ring, and a pair, each 15-20 Âµm long, latero-posteriorly to anal ring. Anal lobes slightly developed; inner margin of each lobe with 1 pointed seta, 10-13 Âµm long and 2-3 Âµm wide, and 1 very long, flagellate seta apically 220-275 Âµm long.
